title: "Runes Reforged", the future of pre-game choices is here folks!
body:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bY67yCaGdno&t=198s

I for once am really excited about this!

Even the comments section of the /dev video thing is separate from the forums so it's yet another place that need to be manually checked for red responses. >.>

(It'll also be interesting to see if maybe people might want to turn around and dump a ton of ip into runes right now in the hopes of turning that IP into something they wouldn't normally be able to get for IP [e.g. key frags/chests].)
Youtube..... and social media..... on their home page

I'm specifically referring to the claim that they [riot] said it's not free ip as compensation, which I still haven't actually found despite skimming the /dev comments and the youtube comments and reddit.

Not ready to talk about that yet, because we're still working on the transition plan. We do want to hear your feedback and have time to act on it though! 

We realize there are a lot of different kinds of players with different priorities and needs for the transition into Preseason and we want to make sure we're taking care of everyone. Once we have something to share, we will share our plans for the transition and we're aiming to give players a degree of control over their transition care package. We'll have more details on this slightly closer to Preseason.

I like that runes give stats and you can organize and shuffle according to how much of particular stats you want.
I do not like the mastery system.
I really don't like keystones at all.

Changing the rune system to be a mastery system worries me.
It sounds like there are going to weird runes that give abilities like masteries would give (only more powerful).
I don't see where we get to pick stats that we think would be useful (which is how runes currently work).

So imo, **it doesn't seem to me like we are getting a new rune system.  It seems like we a losing the rune system and getting a buffed mastery system :/
**
The one good thing is the new system doesn't appear to have Offense, Defense, Utility trees.  I'm really glad to not see that and maybe that is the one thing can can redeem this new system.  The nice things about runes was their flexibility and the bad thing about masteries was the way they forced unwanted choices onto us.

well can you answer my ? its mostly about berserk keystone and jhin since it said it breaks the cap for awhile does this mean that jhin can attack faster i mean yeah he cant get bonus attack speed  from items or other sorces but will this force him to attack faster? im just curious about the interactiong
Jhin's a bit of an odd duck. Berserk will trigger the same AD conversion that items/other sources do for him - won't "force" him to attack faster.

It's like those high level WoW players with like 20 pets.

I just want to note that the overheal is really smart. The way the did it makes it so that overheal from an ally only applies if you yourself are running the keystone. This is the opposite of what we have today where a Soraka enhances her heals on everyone regardless of their masteries.

Now players have to individually choose if they want a bonus to heals or something else. I like the direction this is going in and I can't wait to hear more about it.

I'm really excited to see what sort of tank or juggernaut rune set ups I can make. 

The new honor system is interesting. Do I lose honor if I don't get any votes for periods of time?  Do you lose it if people report or "dishonor" you?  I feel it's open to abuse and threats, but I'm interested to see how it motivates people to play honorable to get better rewards.
According to a Rioter, you lose honor for being penalized after being reported. If you don't get punished after a false report, nothing to worry about.
